docs.lead_paragraph: To prepare for the threat of a medical or bioterror emergency, 10 North Shore villages in the Town of Oyster Bay have coordinated their efforts and created two centralized health care distribution sites, in Bayville and Muttontown. Bayville, Centre Island, Cove Neck, Lattingtown, Laurel Hollow, Matinecock, Mill Neck, Muttontown, Oyster Bay Cove and Upper Brookville -- with a combined population of 15,000 -- have been working together with the Nassau County Health Department to design an emergency plan in the event of a pandemic flu, anthrax exposure, hepatitis outbreak or other disaster that would require mass emergency vaccinations or dispensing of medications. The health care sites are known as PODs, for points of distribution or dispensing.

headline.main: Oyster Bay Villages Create 2 Emergency Centers

docs.abstract: Ten villages in Town of Oyster Bay, NY, working with Nassau County Health Department, have created centralized health care distribution sites in Bayville and Muttontown to prepare for threat of medical or bioterror emergency; photo (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: The government approved a five-year, $2.9 billion program to decrease mortality from diseases that contribute to Russia’s plunging population, including diabetes, tuberculosis, AIDS and cancer. At the same time, the state statistics agency said Russia’s population dropped by more than 560,000 last year, to 142.2 million, a new post-Soviet low. President Vladimir V. Putin has singled out the declining population as a serious hindrance to prosperity. Deaths continue to outnumber births, and life expectancy remains short, particularly for men. The Itar-Tass news agency said male life expectancy in 2005 was 58.9 years. Female life expectancy was 72.3 years.

docs.lead_paragraph: Final data from two clinical trials in Africa suggest that circumcision reduces a man’s risk of contracting H.I.V. by as much as 65 percent — more than suspected when the two trials were stopped because the results were so clear.

headline.main: Circumcision’s Anti-AIDS Effect Found Greater Than First Thought
headline.print_headline: Circumcision’s Anti-AIDS Effect Found Greater Than First Thought
